Design principles

Source: vignettes/design.Rmd
design.Rmd

stackgbm aims to provide a minimalist, research-friendly code base for GBDT model stacking.

Targeted model types

Focus on the three most impactful GBDT model implementations: XGBoost, LightGBM, and CatBoost, to ensure high performance without unnecessary complexity.

Robust model selection

Embrace the traditional grid search and cross-validation approach for parameter tuning, to make model selection robust and understandable.

Key parameter tuning

Provide tuning options for the most impactful parameters (learning rate, maximum depth of a tree, and number of iterations) across GBDT implementations to avoid the risk of overfitting and complexity associated with excessive parameter tuning.

Effective defaults

The default parameter grid balances performance and computational cost, performing effectively across a wide range of scenarios.

Base R implementation

Build with base R to ensure it is easy to understand, modify, and extend.
